Reviews.Title: STUNNING Picture - Get this EH6000 vs ES versions and SAVE $$
Reviews.Author: The Helpful Dad
Reviews.Content: Did a LOT of research prior to purchasing this tv. At first I was dead set on getting the Panasonic P60ST50 Plasma because of all the great ratings for that TV, however when we viewed it in store I just couldnt get past how 'dim/dark' the plasma displays were vs the LED's. I recognize that in-store the tv's are set to display versions that will help stores sell more of what makes them the most money but this dimness is a known issue with plasma's and I could definitely see it. In addition, I did NOT see plasmas as offering a mind-blowing picture vs the LEDs in order to offset the dimness of the display, so that left me with finding the best LED instead...I next researched the Samsungs, LG's, Sharps, and Vizio's for LEDs. In the end, we decided on a Samsung b/c of the good reviews and b/c we had previous good experience with the samsung brand. At first we were going to go with one of the ES (Smart TV) versions of this TV, but after more research and talking to a friend in the industry, we decided that we did not 'need' the 3D option and also that we could get the same or better 'smart' tv options with a 3rd party Digital Media Player add-on vs having it built into the TV. As a result, we decided on the EH6000 and this saved us about $1000!!!Amazon has an excellent comparison chart to help you decide which Samsung TV is best for you in terms of features vs model - simply look at any of the Samsung TVs and you will see the chart under Product Description/Specs area. The EH6000 is essentially the same as the 6100 & 6500 but without the smart tv features. Don't be fooled by the CMR ratings given by samsung - do some research on the "refresh rate" and you will quickly learn that in order to get the 240Hz RR, you need at least a CMR of 720, however many techies will tell you that most people will not notice a RR difference between 120 vs 240 UNLESS you are watching a lot of 3d. If you feel you really want/need the 3d technology, then you'll need to spend the extra money to get the ES7000 or above. However, our view is that in a few years there will be better 3d technology available for less money than what is there now, so we made the decision to forgo the 3d feature since we don't think we'll use it much now and it adds another $500 or so to price. (and since most stations do not currently broadcast in 3d anyway).As for the Smart TV features, this IS something that appeals to us, however the research we did kept saying that while Samsung has the best 'built-in' smart features, they still pale in comparison to what is available from 3rd party add-on boxes like Roku XS, Apple TV, Vizio Costar, etc. Why pay $500 extra for built-in smart TV features when you get can better features from a $100 or so add-on box?Once we decided to NOT add the 3D or the built-in smart features, we were left with EH6000 - thus the $1000+ saving. So, we got this tv, AND added a $90 Roku XS (awesome), AND a $170 Vizio Soundbar with subwoofer (just plug it in and go), AND a $70 Universal Remote AND an subscription to Amazon Prime ($80) AND we still have another %$500+ left vs higher end models. Now we have a better overall system for less money -- Sweet!As for the EH6000, the picture is simply STUNNING. Going from a DLP to this LED has been even more of a noticeable change than when we first went to HD years ago. The CONTRAST, 120Hz Refresh Rate, and overall depth really makes the people/action on the screen POP and my wife and I can't get over how great it looks. Even normal TV shows on NBC, etc look awesome. You will not be disappointed in the picture on this model.Do your research and you'll see that the EH6000 is a great choice. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: This is how a TV should be .. just an awesome TV, nothing more, nothing less.
Reviews.Author: Sujoy Banerjee
Reviews.Content: The title of my review says it all. It is an awesome TV, period.It has no gimmicks like 3D and Apps, it's just you and the stunning screen.Let me recount my experience with this model:I first bought a 55" from Walmart.Everything was good, but it had the dreaded "Dirty Screen Effect".That was prominent in all sports programs and it was horrendous for any soccer match.Initially, I tried to overlook this as everything else was perfect.But after 20 days, I just couldn't watch any sports on this set because of the DSE.Returned the set to Walmart and ordered the 60" model from Amazon.I have had that for the past month and it is exceptional.No issues on this set.There is still a small amount of DSE present in this set also, but it's not as bad as the previous set and I can live with this.Please remember that all LED sets have issues, and the bigger the panel, the chances of an LED related issue is more likely.This set of mine had no other issues like Flashlighting, Blooming, Ghosting, Clouding.Only a small amount of DSE which I can definitely live with.I will note down some pointers for the various aspects of the TV ...Black Levels - Excellent Black levels all over. The Blacks actually look like real world Deep Black rather than grayish. This is very very satisfying to watch, a dark black background or the deep black of a person's suit.Colors - Vibrant colors throughout. Excellent reproduction of the actual colors. Really amazed to see how it's possible to have such vibrant and brilliant colors on a TV set.Soap Opera Effect - This set does have the soap opera effect which all LED's have. You will just have to adjust the settings till you can remove this. For me, I reduced the Sharpness to 20 and selected "Clear" for Auto Motion Plus. This should do the trick for most of you.Sound - Not great, but should be good enough for most of us who are using without a Home theater system.Connections - 2 HDMI, just adequate for me. And if you have a Home Theater System, your receiver should have more HDMI's.USB Connectivity is also available. So plug in your jump drive or external hard drive and play all your video contents directly without even switching on your laptop, how cool is that.Manual Picture Settings - Lots of picture calibration and settings available to tweak to your heart's content. For normal TV viewing, I use "Standard" mode and for Movies and Games I use "Movie" mode.Screen - Screen is sort of Matte finish and not glossy. So this can be used in a brightly lit room without any issues.My Picture Settings :Mode - StandardBacklight - 10  /  Contrast - 75  /  Brightness - 60  /  Sharpness - 20Color - 40  /  Tint - G50/R50Color Space - Native  /  Gamma - 0  /  Dynamic Contrast - OffBlack Tone - Darkest  /  Flesh Tone - 0  /  Motion Lighting - OffColor Tone - Standard  /  Size - Screen Fit  /  Digital Noise Filter - OffFilm Mode - Auto  /  Auto Motion Plus - Clear  /  Led Motion Plus - OffOverall, this is an excellent TV without any bells and whistles which most of us probably won't need.If Picture Quality is all you care about, this is the Best set available at this moment.Thanks for reading this long review and may god bless you all.

Reviews.Title: Almost took it back and then, excellent. Give it a chance.
Reviews.Author: Gio
Reviews.Content: I bought the 60" version of this set from Best Buy as I ended up getting an excellent price. Amazon reviews helped with the decision as did the in store comparisons with other TVs. I was torn between LED sets and plasma sets. The room we use this TV in has huge windows on all sides, and I was worried a plasma would reflect, I was looking at a highly rated Panasonic plasma and was shown some burn in at the store which probably would go away, but seems to keep me from the plasma sets which is too bad because the good ones really are great in the right rooms.I used Cnet to check into ratings based on picture quality as well Amazon, and LCD BUYING GUIDE. I was considering The Sony 850, the LG 7600 and had even considered the new Vizio. I have 2 other Samsung flat screens and have enjoyed them, but saw that Cnet only gave this TV a "Good" rating and did not seem to like the picture quality at all. I saw the price on the 60" version of this TV and decided I could maybe go with it if it actually had a decent picture. When set to "store mode" its hard to do an evaluation and I thought most of the TVs looked the same and this one was as nice as any in the store if not better than a lot of them, so I felt Cnet maybe did not hit the nail on the head. There is a better review for this set from LCD Buying Guide and I felt based on my in store viewing and the price I'd go big, get a 60" TV and be happy.  I did not want smart, or 3D, and it says in all the specs there are only 2 HDMI ports so there is no surprise or reason to mark down. I knew what I was buying and researched enough to know what the TV had and did not. So if it's a problem that there are only 2 HDMI ports, simply don't buy the TV.The only thing I was concerned about was the lack of analog audio out. I have an audiophile grade stereo system I like to hook up for sound, but I'm not interested in surround. I have the solution for anybody that wants to get digital audio over their analog system if needed. Look into affordable DACs (digital audio converters) from Teac, or the DACmagic from Cambridge Audio. I bought the Cambridge DAC for $369 to use and am thrilled with it. It does the job and is a lot less money than the Bryston DAC I wanted for $2100. The Bryston is loads better, but for simple TV with stereo sound, I'm OK with the DACmagic. There are even cheaper DACs but I'm guessing the quality is very questionable. You CAN have stereo sound by using the Toslink (optical out) into the DAC and then to your system. Enjoy it.I got the Samsung home, and had it mounted over the fireplace. I figured the "pros" at Cnet probably had the best advice on calibration settings so I went there to tweak my TV. I usually agree that the movie setting is the best, and I followed the Cnet cal settings. I was horrified!! I Tried another supposed pro calibration basic setting, and again was very upset. Each one I tried made it look like I was watching TV through a screen or smoke. It did not matter if it was Blueray, HDTV or standard there was no clarity and I was baffled. I was quite upset and my wife even commented that the football games looked bad. I did a reset, and tried the stock settings and was still disappointed.Not until I read F Maria's review here and saw the review shared calibration settings did I  see the tides turn. You can argue either way about what true videophile settings should look like. I will be the first to say I hate artificial, overly done picture settings like the in store demos have. That said I think F. Maria's settings certainly looked as close to real as I could get them. I tweaked things here and there to my liking and room lighting. I found I was able to better my other Samsung which I absolutely love.This TV is fully back lit, not edge lit, so there is not light bleed from the sides. The TV is 3+ inches deep but looks just fine, actually beautiful wall mounted. The screen lighting is very uniform/even, and that was also noted as a plus in the Cnet review, however I think that review is way off. The off angle viewing is about the same as any other LED TV. If you use the crappy Cnet settings, the viewing angle is poor, but so is the picture. If you tweak the settings you will be very happy. I'd recommend F. Maria's settings from the review here, and then make small adjustments form there to suit your needs. I actually adjusted the settings similar in both Standard mode and Movie mode. You will have to mirror those adjustments when you play a Blueray because the HDMI 1 and HDMI 2 lines do not share settings.I have an excellent NOT FAKE, looking picture. I strongly urge everybody to spend some time with the settings if you don't like the picture. I was a little upset by the fact that the TV really needed work to get it where I wanted it. As I said there were 2-3 days where I was getting ready to return it. There are some better pictures and TVs , but not in this price range/size, and not that much better in the more expensive price ranges, especially at 60".This set has everything I need, skips the 3D and smart features, a PS3 will get you back into the smart game if needed. Personally I buy a TV for the picture 1st and go from there. I don't think it's a mystery that flat screen TVs don't have booming audio, but this set has adequate sound.I will not go into what everybody says about customer service. I think it's bad all around in general and should not be used to RATE a TV's performance. Every TV on Amazon has some bad reviews, and every manufacturer gets gigged for poor customer service.I rate this set a 5 based on Picture quality, price and size. The remote is adequate although small, the sound is decent and the picture is great.I would say buy one, and expect to have to work a bit to get the picture where you want it. My settings and taste for picture may be a lot different than your's, so you may be satisfied right out of the box. I try to get the TV as close to REAL colors and tones as possible this TV did get me there, it just took some work.

Reviews.Title: Best tv purchased in lifetime!
Reviews.Author: tmelloy34
Reviews.Content: This Samsung 60 inch tv is totally awesome. Absolutely worth every penny. Picture quality is outstanding. Feels like you're looking right through a window at a live event. Tv base is adequate and won't topple over. Audio is also adequate. Hooked up to surround sound and have no issues with sound isolation.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to hang over my fireplace in a large den with cathedral ceilings.  I went with a Samsung as I have a nine year old Plasma (55 in.), also made by Samsung and have had no issues at all.  The picture is amazing.  The detail is excellent and the colors are vibrant.  The speakers are also a very good quality as it has superior sound.  It is a really good looking unit.  Sleek, slim and lightweight.  I purchased it along with a bracket that allows for the unit to be pulled in or out and turn the unit from left to right for optimal viewing.  The bracket came with the HDMI cables. Cheetah Mounts Plasma LCD Flat Screen TV Articulating Full Motion Dual Arm Wall Mount Bracket For 32-65 inches Displays Up To 165LBS Black With 10 cm High Speed HDMI Cable With Ethernet Fits Up To 24 feet Studs.  The unit comes with tons of features allowing you to adjust picture quality from daytime, evening, poor lighting conditions, movies, concerts, etc.  You can do this with sound as well ... movie, concerts, surround sound feature, etc.  I have not had time to explore fully all the features listed in the manual, but am really impressed over all with the picture quality.  It looks beautiful as well hanging over the mantle. Free shipping with prime membership, no tax and 2% back in Amazon rewards only sweetened the deal. I couldn't be happier with the purchase!I have only had this TV installed for a few days now and I already felt the need to come back and edit my original review.  Yesterday, my daughter and I sat down to watch the season premiere of our favorite shows. We couldn't get over the detail, color and quality of the picture. You literally can see imperfections on the actor's faces ( large pores, etc.) and individually highlighted strands of hair. I can't fully explain the detail. It really has to be experienced. The color enhancing feature delivers such rich, full bodied color to the screen. This TV absolutely exceeds my expectations. I was not in the market for 3D as I heard the technology is not quite there yet. As well, I know a couple of people who have made the investment, and other then when first purchased, they rarely use the 3D feature. I didn't need Wi-Fi steaming for video as I already have a Blu-Ray and wasn't looking to duplicate services. Still, there are plenty of features (most of which I'll never use), such as playing music and videos through USB drive. The unit also has a special technology that detects action packed movement allowing for extra sharp detail and better contrast. Perfect for sports. If you are simply looking for the best picture quality, amazing detail, vivid color and truly impressive sound, without additional features you would never use, then this unit is exceptional for the money!Also, if you have any issues at all with lighting, this is your TV. I hung a perfectly working 55 inch Plasma over my fireplace. The room has a cathedral ceiling so I have three windows (two long and one short) on either side on the unit. No matter what I tried, I could barely see the screen of the Plasma with all the light pouring in through the top two windows. It was literally unviewable during the day, due to the glare. Window coverings on middle and upper windows wasn't optional for me. One of the reasons I moved to this house was because of all the beautiful natural lighting. I figured after nine years, it was time to move the Plasma upstairs and invest in a new TV. Best decision I ever made. One of the best purchases I have ever made as well.*Pic attached.

Reviews.Title: Hi Failure Rate, Poor Service
Reviews.Author: FixEverything
Reviews.Content: TV work great but only lasted 2 weeks longer than Amazon would allow a return.  It worked perfect in the morning and when we returned home and turned it on there was no video.  So it was a great TV for 6 weeks.Opened a ticket on Samsung website on Tuesday and a local service company said they would call Thursday with a 2 hour window to come out.  Samsung confirmed with an email to me. Thursday at noon I called them and they said they had no record of talking to me.  The representative I spoke to said they had all kinds of "glitches" with Samsung support and may Samsung customers calling.  They have to order parts and the soonest they can schedule someone out there is Monday.  I called Samsung and the service representative there said they don't have a problem, the problem is with the service contractor.  Now someone will have to take a day off work to wait for service Monday.  Nice going Samsung, way to promote your brand...Update: No one called by 11:30 Monday as they said they would.  I called the dispatcher and after about 20 minutes the technician called and said they would be out between 1 and 3.  He did show up but didn't have the right part with him.  He did go get the part which took about an hour and it did fix the TV.  For those interested, it was the tcon card.  The repair was successful and the TV works again as new.  However, as above, the infant mortality of the electronics combined with the poor service experience is disappointing.  I am completely satisfied with the features and function of the TV but if I had a do over I would look at Sony or Sharp to see if they may have better reliability and service.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but I expected better from Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Who Dat
Reviews.Content: First of all let me write that my true rating is 3.5 stars, but since that is not available I decided to round down.  I have had the TV for almost a month now and unfortunately, the picture is not quite as good as my five year old Samsung LNT4671F LCD that it replaced.  Still very good for sure, but not as good.  Yes, the TV only has two HDMI inputs, but I knew that before I bought it (and I was OK with that so no score reduction there).  However, as far as I am concerned, it only has one (I'll get to that shortly).  This TV is also not a SMART TV, but in my case, that was exactly what I was looking for.  The price was definitely very good (a little over $1K).Five stars for Amazon customer service though.  The first TV arrived DOA (failed the "power on" test) with a huge crack in the display.  I called Amazon customer service and another TV was sent out the next day.  When the second TV arrived, the delivery company hauled away the broken one.  Overall, a smooth and excellent experience.After several hours of playing with the settings and reading many reviews I settled on the following:PICTUREMode: MovieBacklight: 15Contrast: 100Brightness: 45Sharpness: 10Color: 50Tint: G50/R50ADVANCED SETTINGSColor Space: AutoGamma: +1Dynamic Contrast: offBlack Tone: OffFlesh Tone: 0Motion Lighting: OffWHITE BALANCER-Offset: 26G-Offset: 24B-Offset: 25R-Gain: 24G-Gain: 25B-Gain: 20PICTURE OPTIONSColor Tone: Warm2Size: Screen FitDigital Noise Filter: AutoHDMI Black Level: Low (*** see complaint below)Film Mode: OffLED Motion Plus: OffAUTO MOTION PLUSCustom SettingBlur Reduction: 10Judder Reduction: 0SOUNDMode: StandardSRS TruSurround HD: OffAuto Volume: OffEQUALIZER100Hz:  Two notches down from the highest "+" setting300Hz: All the way to the "+" setting1KHz: Two notches down from the highest "+" setting3KHz: All the way to the "+" setting10KHz: All the way to the "+" settingGame Mode: Off*** OK, so here is the big gripe.  The picture settings I listed above ONLY work with the HDMI 2 input.  For whatever reason the HDMI 1 input defaults the "HDMI Black Level" setting to "Normal" and it cannot be changed (and it makes a BIG difference).  I have played with other settings for hours (Brightness, Gamma, Flesh Tone, etc.) to no avail.  I cannot match the picture quality of HDMI 2 on HDMI 1.  Therefore, this TV effectively only has one HDMI input.For anyone who has a newer receiver that supports HDMI the answer is simple - plug all your components into the receiver and then run the output to HDMI 2 on the TV.  For anyone who does not either invest in a decent HDMI switch or do not buy this TV.  I purchased a switch (about $15), and so far that solution works perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: Broke after a month and a half!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV January 15 and it was broken by March 5!  It just started turning itself on and off constantly.Of course, it is outside of Amazon's 30 day return window (though I don't know how we would return a 60 inch TV).It took Samsung support 10 days to order parts and send someone to service the TV.  Apparently, there were 3 parts that could have been malfunctioning...and the technician only brought 2 of them (we were told because the 3rd part was really expensive and they try not to order it unless they have to).  Once the 2 parts were hooked up the TV continued to turn itself on and off, but now also has vertical lines across the screen.Now we are waiting for the 3rd part to be delivered to see if that will fix the problem.  Oh, and all these "new" parts that they are putting in the TV are really refurbished parts.  So, essentially IF this part fixes the problem we will have a totally refurbished TV that we spent $1200 on.

Reviews.Title: Version HS01 = No Good
Reviews.Author: edgeh2o
Reviews.Content: The version on the 60" EH6000 I received was HS01. The "H" dictates a Sharp panel, which is notorious for having the "purple tinge" issue. Basically, when dark/gray things move in front of bright backgrounds (a person wearing a dark suit walking across a bright room), the edges of the dark things turn purple. This isn't noticeable in all programming, but it does happen enough to become an issue. Happens all the time in Boardwalk Empire, where you have lots of darks and grays.Pros:Completely even backlightNo flashlighting or edge-bleed (perfect for watching stuff with the lights out)Blacks are blackGreat PriceDecent PQDecent viewing angleLow input lagCons:Motion could be improvedPurple edges/tinges when some things moveHS01 panelAccording to certain user communities, Txxx panels are the best and Hxxx panels are the worst for the EH6000 series.My search continues...

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60EH6000 The thin blue line
Reviews.Author: anemone "dm"
Reviews.Content: We have had the TV for 2 months and were pretty satisfied with the product. However, will warn that this TV is not a "plug and play" product. Yes, it has a very high quality picture but you have to make many adjustments or you will have a "super real" picture that is very over sharpened and contrasty making people appear to float in the screen, kind of like a video game with a bizarre over-detailed depth of field. However, that is not why I gave it one star; I figure if you get this kind of TV, you should be smart enough to adjust the picture. I gave it one star because after 2 short months, a vertical thin blue line appeared just to left of center of the screen. The line stayed on the screen regardless of any components, e.g., DVD players, that were attached. Some internet research caused me to suspect that the screen would have to be replaced and sure enough, it does. I spent an hour doing the online chat thing with a Samsung rep and then another hour filling out a technical claim. Had to do a follow up call on my own because no one contacted me to tell me what was going on. This was 5 days ago and I have been told that a technician in my area has been contacted, a replacement screen has been ordered and in about 5-10 business days it should arrive and they will make an appointment to come to my house to replace it. That should be fun. We'll see how it all works out. In conclusion, so far I have had a fairly reasonable response from Samsung, it is obviously under warranty so will be fixed free of charge. However, it is a MAJOR inconvenience for a pretty expensive piece of equipment and I am worried about what happens after the 1 year warranty runs out. Will this happen again? I guess buying a new TV every year is good for the economy but I really am not that patriotic.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!!
Reviews.Author: Zachary Joy
Reviews.Content: Love this TV! Excellent price for a beautiful TV without all of the add-ons. I did not want a TV with 3D (passing fad) or internet connectivity. All I wanted was a TV with a great picture and this TV delivered. I went from a 55" LCD to this 60" LED and the difference is amazing. LED delivers such clarity it's amazing. Also, the blacks are so black- to the point that when a show goes black you think the TV is turned off. The profile of the TV is thicker than others on the market, so if you are mounting on the wall check the dimentions. I have a TV stand so that was not a factor to me. Excellent TV!!

Reviews.Title: Frankotwo
Reviews.Author: Frankotwo
Reviews.Content: This 60 inch TV is all that I expected. Used the reviews to set up the picture and it worked great. It's  a basic tv but that's all I need. Consumer Reports rated the picture excellent and over all it got real high marks and was a recommended buy. I don't think you can go wrong if you buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love my TV and price was ridiculously good
Reviews.Author: Goddess
Reviews.Content: TV is awesome.  Picture is great.  Screen is great.  Delivery system was pretty good.  It was raining and they wanted to leave outside but at least they called me to ask what they wanted me to do with it.  The price was insanely good.  IT IS NOT A SMART TV.  If you want Netflix and the web to be built in this is not the TV you want. However, buy a $60 blue ray Smart player that offers many more options than most smart TVs and it will save you the extra $300-$400 that a smart TV feature will cost you.  This TV does have a USB port and a built in media player program.  You can plug in an external hard drive (or computer) and play movies, music, slide shows with pictures.  The oooonnnnllllyyyyyyyy thing that I am bummed about is It only has 2 HDMI ports.  however the ports are placed on the outside edge of the TV so its easy tome change the cord between devises.  To be fair there is one thing I noticed as well-  The sound is not amazing-however, due to flat TVs size, companies are not able to put in the speakers they use to, something that is a pretty common problem with all ultra thin flat screens. So I can't really say that the sound problem is specific to this brand make and model of TV.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Poughquager
Reviews.Content: I'm upgrading to my first HD experience, so naturally I am super impressed with the picture quality.  I had read a review somewhere that made me a bit fearful that the blacks would not be really black, and maybe there are videophile machines that are even better but I find the black of this screen to be really good.I intentionally did not get an internet-connected "smart" TV, because I wanted to get the most picture and not pay extra for dubious frills; I got a Samsung Blu-ray "smart" player to go with this TV, so my only complaint is that the TV doesn't do Anynet+ (I missed that in the fine print) so it doesn't turn on the blu-ray player automatically.  Speaking of fine print, some specs say that this TV doesn't have a 3.5mm audio out jack, but it does have one (nice for use with my cordless headphones). (I think you may want to avoid the 6003 model for that reason; in spite of having a higher model number, it skimps on some little features like this.)The delivery service through Amazon was smooth; a nice man carried the big box up stairs with a little help from me (I was surprised that they only sent one person). Again with the fine print -- I thought at first that they would set it up for me, but reading carefully you find that the delivery people do not hook it up, they are only supposed to power it on to make sure it turns on, however there is a caveat that if the outside temperature is low they won't power it up because it needs to come to room temperature first. This is smart and all stated clearly in the fine print if you take the time to read it!

Reviews.Title: Best performance for value
Reviews.Author: S. Srinivasan
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung TV but the first LED TV purchase. I saw the extremely competitive price on Amazon and checked out all the features. This TV has some interesting features. Please note I did have to make adjustments to the default settings but once I did, it was the way to go ! Another surprise was the surround sound. This TV is perfect for our family room and can be seen both up close and at a distance. Tonight we watched a SCI-FI movie on it for the first time in HD and was blown away. The Samsung UN60EH6000 is by far the best value for high performance. The only downside to this TV appears to be the single set of A/V component inputs. It does have two HDMI inputs though. Delivery was extremely efficient as was installation.

Reviews.Title: Burnt LED?
Reviews.Author: Green Crayon
Reviews.Content: The T.V. was amazing. I love the size and all the ports that come with it. One day my son left the T.V. on Cartoon Network, overnight. I woke up the next morning to change the channel and the cartoon network logo was burned into the screen. Still though, its a good T.V. Just make sure not to leave it on overnight,

Reviews.Title: Nice tv, until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: Ellellelle
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat, the tv picture quality is not stunning.  However, a little tweaking and the set will have a lovely picture.  My beef with this tv?  I had it for about three months before it developed a big red vertical line on the right side of the set.  The tv works still, but there is obviously a failure that happened with it.  Samsung themselves has terrible customer service and it has been a complete nightmare that is taking a month to get it repaired.  I know it can be repaired which is why it's still getting three stars.  But a failure after three months leaves me skeptical if this thing will last.Edit: been repaired after a frustrating experience with Samsung. The large panel took a very long time in transit, so the slowness is partly to blame on the size of the tv. When I first experienced the issue, I sent Samsung a photo and detailed description of the problem.  They ended up ordering a new panel and cable without ever coming by to take a look at it. I recommend being as detailed as possible because it will speed up an already painstakingly slow repair process.  Repairman was very pleasant and it is so far working fine.  Picture looks great again. Hopefully it won't fail again.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: Baileigh
Reviews.Content: My old CRT finally died and I bought this as a replacement.  This is my first venture into HDTV and I knew I did not want a Smart TV that would just confuse me.  I researched for about 6 months and selected this model and I am very pleased with but the delivery and the unit itself.  The picture is amazing, sometimes too amazing when you can see every blemish on faces but the nature shows are so beautiful.  The tech that came to hook up my new HD DVR was amazed at the volume quality and limits and stated there was no need for a sound bar with this TV.  Everyone that has seen it agrees the picture and sound quality are excellent.  It was very easy to put together.  If you are new to HD and don't want to pay for a SMART TV, this is a great unit.  Samsung is the very best!  Save your money and buy a new laptop to connect to your TV.  That works much better!

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: R. M. Kuhlmann
Reviews.Content: Very bright and clear picture, but sill has judder/blur during quick action shots. Plasma is still the best picture out there, but this is a good compromise, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful display, make sure you set some time to tweak out of the box!
Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: I got the HS01 panel, so depending on what panel version you get your mileage may vary.  Out of the box, the sharpness was WAY off, hooking up a PC to it was really painful to watch.  After using some calibration images and running the Windows monitor calibration wizard, things are pretty much perfect.  Still tweaking a bit with the Motion Plus stuff and auto black levels, but so far I have no complaints, just needed to spend a little quality time with the display after you unbox it.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Richard Gardiner
Reviews.Content: fast prompt delivery and the guy who brought it checked that it worked even thought was no help in manageing all those imput wires.  The TV works great and we enjoyed much Christmas viewing from Football to we games to Tabernacle Choir.  Attached nicely to DVR and Bose sound system.  Everything is fine so fare.  Thanks, I always try to buy throught Amazon if possible.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING!!
Reviews.Author: calc "calc"
Reviews.Content: Great HDTV, with amazing Picture.  Works great with my Playstation 3.  Games and Movies are stunning.  Have had great luck with Samsung TVs.  This 60 inch TV, a 40 inch TV, and two 27" TVs, all by Samsung, and not one single dead or stuck pixel on any of these TVs!!!

Reviews.Title: UN60EH6000
Reviews.Author: Mr. Richard E. Bolin
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews I could find for this tv and despite some of the criticisms went with it over other brands.  WOW!!!!Picture is superb.  Was great right out of the box and I made no adjustments to factory settings.  I'm sure there are viewing critics who would find fault BUT if all you want is a tv with a great picture at a great price this is the one.  True it could use at least one more HDMI connection but if you are older like me without kids then you will pleased with this purchase.  Delivery was prompt and the delivery person was very helpful.  This was a great purchase as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: Great BUT.......
Reviews.Author: Alexandre T
Reviews.Content: Bought a Samsung for my living room because of its great reputation. In addition to the TV, I bought a Samsung sound bar & Samsung Blue-ray DVD. I bought all the same brand to have an easy interface. Boy I was wrong!!! Very very difficult to hook up the sound bar, the instructions were not clear at all.  Then once that worked, I had an issue with the DVD's audio to come out of the sound bar, as it was coming out of the TV's speakers....frustrating.When it was time to buy a set for my bedroom, I went with the exact same set up (TV/Soud Bar/Blue-Ray DVD), but I went with LG. It was up and running just after plugging the wires where they're suppose to go & voilà I was watching & enjoying my LG TV in Litterally  few minutes.Don't get me wrong, Samsung & LG both have EXCELLENT picture/sound quality, but the Samsung's installation was sooooo complicated & difficult v/s the LG one, that my preference from now on will be the awesome & simple to install : LG.

Reviews.Title: Amazing television
Reviews.Author: Old Retired Guy "Kennymac"
Reviews.Content: When I researched this set I was amazed by it's image quailty in the store and thought to myself, "yeah, but will it be that good at home?" Price comparison resulted in my ordering it from Amazon with a certain degree of aprehension about delivery and set up, potential for damage and so on.I was amazed when it arrived in two days! And the delivery guys brought it in, unpacked it, and turned it on to make sure it was in order as delivered. WOW. I was not ready for that one! In doing this they help me past the hardest part; lifting it up onto it's new home.So, this is an amazing Television / monitor. I replaced a seven year old Panasonic Plasma set which I thought was great, and it is / was until we "burned" the edges watching old movies. No such problem with LCD / LED sets which is why I chose this one. I am on HD cable and I play home made 1080P movies and slide shows of my grandkids and travels. It's wonderful. It has a whole range of controls I am just learning to use but the backlit LED is fantastic since not all recodings are created equal; you can add or subtract brightness amd contrast as needed. I love this thing!

Reviews.Title: Nice Transaction
Reviews.Author: Jefferson Bauer
Reviews.Content: So my 2004 50" Samsung TV's bulb went out during the olympic's 3 days ago.  I heard the click.  After 8 years with that TV, I decided it was time for a new one.  I was trying to hold out to get the new OLED TVs but I think I'm going to be happy holding out for the price to come down and any bugs to get worked out.  Anyway, this is the first time buying a high ticket item on Amazon.  Under $1,500 for this TV is unbelievable.  Plus, free shipping with my Prime account.  The only complaint I could make, is that the delivery guys that came out were supposed to get to my house by 11 AM.  I got a call at 10:45 AM from the delivery company indicating that they would be at our house between 11 and Noon.  They then arrived at 12:15 PM.  Since I was able to work from home today, it wasn't a problem for me.  I was pleasantly surprised when they arrived, unpacked and installed it for me on the stand it comes with in less than 10 minutes.  They told me Amazon contracted them.  I would buy another TV using Amazon.*** UPDATE 8/12/2012 ***Okay, so I was a little too quick to write this review.  After watching this TV for a few hours I noticed some vertical digital imperfections on the right quarter of the screen.  I thought maybe it was the receiver but it even shows up intermittently when you pause recorded video.  Ugggghhhh.  I went to My Amazaon Account, Orders menu and hit the return button.  I saw a number to call Amazon.  I called and only waited a brief moment to get someone on the phone.  I explained the issue and they apologized and said it sounded like the TV was defective.  They said they would be sending a new TV and having the company delivering it would pick up the defective one so that I wouldn't have to worry about any of it.  I'm leaving this rating as a 5 Stars for now and see how the new TV install, old TV pickup and performance goes.  Right now I'm pleased with Amazon's return policy.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Jeff O
Reviews.Content: I purchased a large and expensive Samsung LED TV from Amazon. Amazon was great. Fast and easy delivery. Unfortunately after 10 months, the TV stopped functioning at all. It made a clicking sound when you pressed the power button, but no image or sound. Fortunately, it was still under warranty. I contacted Samsung. They sent out a local repairman who fixed the TV. He mentioned it would have cost $1000 for the repair (replacing 2 circuit boards) if I was paying for it. It took him <3 minutes to switch the boards. The TV worked again. Now 2 years later - same problem. I called Samsung. They very politely told me that I was screwed. They would not fix the TV, provide parts or even a provide discount on the repair or parts despite the fact that it was the same problem the TV experienced 2 years earlier. Beware - if you do not want a very expensive paperweight after 3 years time, look at another manufacturer for your next TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Buy
Reviews.Author: A. J. Haas "A.J. Haas"
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? The process was as easy as it gets. Flawless delivery. Sits beautifully in our living room. Great viewing angles and beautiful picture.

Reviews.Title: You are insane if you buy a Samsung product
Reviews.Author: James Obrien "Solo742"
Reviews.Content: This TV started out life fine. Great picture etc... And then boom. Less that a couple months out of the 1 year warranty. No picture, and for the low, low, price of 420.00 we could "extend" our warranty and have it fixed. What a scam. Check the reviews online. This company and TV line are a joke and you are wasting your money on them. I have a Phillips and a Sony that are both doing fine after several years. Buy another product. Samsung is not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this TV!!!
Reviews.Author: John Slabinski
Reviews.Content: This TV stopped working just after the warranty expired. Sound but no picture. Did some investigation online. This is a common problem and is a design flaw. Stay away from this tv.

Reviews.Title: Thought it won't happened to me
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: The TV stopped working (no picture) after I bought it for 1 year 4 months...right passed the 12 month warranty.  After 3 months of purchase got flashing screens once in a while (maybe once a month) and thought it was no big deal since it came back to normal after restarting the TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, Bad sound
Reviews.Author: Michael Alexander
Reviews.Content: Picture is amazing, and it feels like you're IN the movie. Best picture I have ever had. However, the sound (like most Big screen TV's) is just ok. Its echoey, and if you pump up the volume the whole TV vibrates. Definately invest in a sound system.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: J. Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for over a year now and works great. It looks nice, it has great user friendly settings, inputs, and controls. The picture quality is top notch and it turns itself off after a period of non-use. I'm now a loyal customer of samsung TVs

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Firepres28
Reviews.Content: Hung on the wall, wires hidden, and it looks great.  Remote will not control my samsung sound system. In a 22'x22' room.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, husband loves it
Reviews.Author: Lauren L OMalley
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband as a birthday and Christmas gift in 2012.  He was beside himself with the quality of this TV.  We moved up from a 50" projector flatscreen and aside from the energy savings and lowered heat emission, this TV has so many different picture settings and amazing clarity.  I'm not a TV person and I feel it is DEFINITELY an improvement to our cinematic experiences !

Reviews.Title: picture perfect
Reviews.Author: Alison Beavan
Reviews.Content: Great picture and easy set up.  Great value for such a great product.  I highly recommend this product.  I was able to set it up within minutes and was very pleased with the outcome.

Reviews.Title: Green pixel shines when screen is black
Reviews.Author: gilbert dave "Gilbert Dave"
Reviews.Content: what else is there to say. When the screen is covered with full real estate display , I don't see it. When my Directv DVR goes off (power saving mode) the TV goes black and the green pixel glows in bright green color in the left corner. I spoke with Samsung support, they are willing to send a locally contracted people to check it out. I chose to not have them come to my home, I can live with it.I won't let some local repair people who aren't Bona fide Samsung's tech to take the tv apart and then make me wait for weeks/ months for "some part" to arrive from Korea.other than that I do like the display when I watch normal programming , Netflix Etc...

Reviews.Title: Good tv with a few things to mention
Reviews.Author: Jay Walters
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice tv. Color looks great and it is really bright. A few things to mention is the clear motion technology on some tv shows can cause a bit of shutter when there are a bunch of artifacts on screen (shrubs, trees etc.) but overall the technology still works really well. I would have liked to see a few more HDMI ports but two suits my needs. I really like the thin bezel and I can definitely say coming from a 2010 60" Sony the power bill was cut by about $15 a month.

Reviews.Title: one fantastic product
Reviews.Author: Gordon R. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Samsung has really outdone itself with this LED TV The quality and price can't be beat. It does have a default setting you will want to  turn off, though. It is a motion setting that claims will help with fast movements across the screen. Instead, it actually makes everything look like it is made for a soap opera. You do not need this setting to make movement on screen smooth. If you go on google, you will see much info about this as well.There is only one USB port, but that has not been a problem for me. You can connect a flash drive directly  into the side of the TV and display  pictures or play videos just as though it is a DVD player.

Reviews.Title: Price was right
Reviews.Author: #1Dad
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to be thrilled with this product.  We had an issue with the picture flickering in and out when using and HDMI cable from our DirectTV genie DVR.  The problem was resolved by using the RGB connectors.  Unfortunately not using HDMI defeats the purpose of having a HD LED tv.  Hoping this is a DirectTV issue and not the tv but when troubleshooting online other customers were also experiencing this issue.  Going to give it another shot in the next week.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: J. Lever
Reviews.Content: I have not tweaked the settings yet as the picture is great right out of the box.  I watch it in a room with large windows and a lot of sunlight and still have a good picture.  I use HD cable so have not tested the TV's tuner. The sound is good.  While others have criticized this TV for having only 2 HDMI inputs, this is not a problem for me as I use them to connect my DVD player and my HD cable box.  I didn't want 3D.  As for wi-fi, this feature can be added separately at less expense, i.e. with a wi-fi Blu-ray player. The TV uses back-lit technology, which I feel is superior to edge-lit.  All in all, I am pleased with this purchase and the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: John A. Cooke
Reviews.Content: TV was delivered on-time and in perfect condition.  Easy to setup - its just plug and play.  Picture is awesome - looks much better than my older plasma TV.The auto-dimming feature is a little puzzling (it changes the picture brightness) - but its not a bad thing.  Only one AV (non-HDMI) connection on the TV; so you will have to choose between connecting the Wii and certain other devices that dont have HDMI connections.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Duncand57
Reviews.Content: I recently finished my man cave (basement) and began the research to find the best TV for the price.  After looking primarily at the picture first, then whistles and bells second, I kept coming back to Samsung, which I felt had the absolute best picture.  At first I was  going to buy a smart TV, but quickly realized that in my rural setting, the smart TV options would be nearly useless, so I went with EH6000 which for all intents and purposes could be referred to as a dumb TV because it doesn't have an internet browser, etc.Well as it turns out most of that stuff was available with Direct TV's Genie which I had ordered to complement the TV.When you get down to brass tacks, this is one nice TV, and a person nearly feels like they are in a movie theater watching it!

Reviews.Title: Huge,Clear Picture
Reviews.Author: E. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television for my husband for his birthday and I have not been happier; with his response as well as the television. It's not a smart TV but it adapts to apps and The DirectTV technician introduced us to several features we did not now about.  I'm still learning so I can't be more in depth about the TV until I get a better handle on it's functions.  Bottom line,  I'm so glad I bought it from Amazon because I got a great deal and it was delivered right to my door.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: TD
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome Tv. I ddint wanted an Internet tv as I have connected my mac mini to this one throught Hdmi ! AWESOME PRODUCT AT A GREAT PRICE!

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Travis Krichman
Reviews.Content: great tv for a great price, a little difficult to get on the stand with just one person, you will definitely need two people to setup

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: O. Coles
Reviews.Content: Easily tuned settings for accurate color scale. My only gripe is that the USB port is located below the HDMI slots.

Reviews.Title: perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: dmitry yurchuk
Reviews.Content: internet, netflix no problem thru: dvd with ethernet plug.picture is great.fast mothion is ok.for extra hdmi ports getting splitter is inexpencive.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60EH6000
Reviews.Author: Norm Binkley
Reviews.Content: It has just the features I want and need, with no additional bells and whistles that I don't.  This is my second Samsung flat-screen and my first LED.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLANT PICTURE, SECOND TO NONE
Reviews.Author: GJM
Reviews.Content: Unit was delivered in one piece, but tested on floor and not lifted to TV table. But was able to complete task with 4ft. 11in. female companion. Also, you have to connect your own cables which was not a big task; however, might be complicated for some. Use previous  TV setup as a guide.For best settings of set, used what was found done by others in prior Amazon reviews. Picture quality was much better than any of the highly rated plasma sets seen in stores especially for brightness and impact. In addition, did not see the gritty vertical lines when closely viewing plasmas. One thing Samsung could have done better was to include a guide booklet as they had done with my other Samsung 46 in. instead of simply instructions on a sheet of paper.Two possible shortcomings include: screen more reflective than my old 55 in. Sony even though light from picture window comes in at 90 degree angle making daytime viewing a little harder on the eyes; and, off-center viewing deteriorates picture quality much after a 45 degree angle. But on-axis, can't be beat! In all fairness to picture quality, can't see difference between my two Samsungs with the older one being of a previous design.Tried HDMI and component connections and could see no difference in quality.The sound quality was a big surprise as I compared it connected to my HIFI setup and could only here the difference in the very low bass. Otherwise the sound quality was equal and could very well live without an elaborate system with the extra expense of the equipment and cost of electricity.However, did not try a Dolby Surround setup.Waited a while to buy this set until Amazon lowered their price to what I considered a previous low price. In summary, would but again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Mark Vosburgh
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality. No problems thus far. I could purchase another model for less, but you get what you pay for, I would rather pay a little more and enjoy the better quality over the long haul.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Bon Jovi
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded from a Panasonic 720p Plasma 50 inch.  This TV smokes it! It also smokes all of the Vizio, Sharp and other brands I was looking at.  Samsung's picture is the bomb! You won't regret having this TV! I hesitated because of the price difference but the quality definately outways the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Holland
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews that said the picture was mediocre (CNET) but my experience has been great. The colors are bright with great saturation. I have noticed some light-ness to the blacks, but nothing that disappoints. What actually surprised me was that the 'true motion' effects usually drive me crazy on the newer TV's. Everything looks unnatural.  That is not the case with this TV - somehow, they give you a crisp/responsive picture that POPs, but doesn't look strange.It only has 2 HDMI, so take note if you need the TV to act as the media center's hub.Also, here are some simple calibration guidelines for you: [...]

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Mcrae
Reviews.Content: The television is very good.  Easy to hook up.  I was disappointed by the delivery. It was supposed to be white glove.  There was to be two people to set the television up.  Only one arrived.  Person did not know how to put television together (base and body).  Not to happy with the shipping company.

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the price.
Reviews.Author: Elie G
Reviews.Content: Great buy, got it on sale with free delivery, picture is great. So far so good, I had to adjust a few setting out of the box to get a perfect picture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Yatin Ghosh "AumTatSat"
Reviews.Content: Energy saver with excellent picture Quality; had no problem and performing as expected - highly recommended for all interested users

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Kucera
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use. Needs another HDMI connector or two. Picture quality very good. Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous TV
Reviews.Author: Lee Jensen
Reviews.Content: This TV is really fantastic. The picture is excellent and very evenly lit. My only complaint in this regard is a very slight vignetting in the corners. I don't notice it when viewing content. The only time I've seen it is when a solid color is displayed on screen (in my case the xbox's netflix loading screen). Each corner has a slightly darkened semi circle. Again this doesn't seem to impact regular viewing but is noticeable on certain menu type interfaces. Have this thing hooked up to an APC UPS that has power monitoring. With only the TV on it uses approximately 100W of electricity. Rather incredible for such a large set I'd think.

Reviews.Title: Returning... again
Reviews.Author: RW
Reviews.Content: After returning the first one -thinking something must be wrong with it after reading all the reviews on here- I am now returning the second unit after only 5 days of use.  The colors on this thing are NOT right.  Skin tones are just off, period, no matter what tweaks you do in the settings.  I'm a photographer and consider myself pretty adept at calibrating / dialing in displays but can't for the life of me get this one right.  Faces are either overly purple, red or orange.  Also, motion doesn't look right.  With "auto motion plus" on you get the dreaded soap opera affect.  Can't stand it.  With it off you get lagging and pixelation.  The wife and I went to Best Buy today, where all LED's looked overly bright / washed out and all plasmas looked great.  Going with plasma (Panasonic VIERA TC-P60GT50 60-Inch 1080p 600Hz Full HD 3D Plasma TV).

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: Alan Hamilton
Reviews.Content: A month ago I purchased a Samsung TV  because of their quality reputation. I am very happy with my decision to buy the 60" because of the great picture. I also got a great price so I bought it right before the NFl playoffs.I would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Possibly overrated but still a nice tv
Reviews.Author: MikeBNj
Reviews.Content: I bought this LCD TV(60inch) with the reputation Samsung has gotten when it comes to picture quality and presentation. I have to say, this is a nice looking LCD TV but the picture quality, SO far, hasn't left me all jaw dropped yet.  Some of the reviews I read made it sound like the black colors were highly rich and almost flawless. This is not at all the case as in some movies I've watched, I've noticed greyish areas in the black and even some pixelated squares. This could be due to the program I watched but in any case, it wasn't comforting to see. The 240 CMR sometimes I wonder if it's too new technology to be truely effective. There are many times with this particular tv where it almost seems like the TV cannot keep up with the motion and there is a bit of blur/lag to the image. This also is an effect that takes some time to get used to as you no longer get that cinematic look to a movie or tv show. Instead everything looks like it was shot with a walmart camcorder and special effects were added in with an over the counter product. This is a hit and miss and generally a miss so far in my opinion.  I will say, the few 1080p movies I have seen mostly through youtube clips running at that resolution, they have looked phenomenal. I think it's just the majority of the content I have viewed hasn't been high resolution and in most cases blown up for the big screen/high res and it just doesn't look good. Especially DVDs running on my Samsung Blu Ray.  To keep this review short, let me get to the aesthetics of the TV now.  It looks great! The bezel is very thin considering other TVs out for similar costs. The Samsung logo sits at the very bottom and there are no LED lights anywhere to be seen to disrupt your viewing. That's a major plus for me. The stand is strong and wide to give it some good grounding. I have it sitting on top of a wooden TV stand and it looks great high up. It's a pleasant looking TV and I have no issues with it.  This type of TV may require some tweaking out of the box to get that picture perfect image that Samsung is known to have but I haven't had the chance to play around with it yet. I'm sure once I dive into more modern media and Blu Ray movies, the quality of everything will go up. Unfortunately I don't do enough of the newer media to take advantage of the quality I'm sure this TV possesses. My initial impression has been hit and miss but believe me, I'm not disappointed because I know of the potential that is there and I'm probably holding it back. I will update this review most likely in the future after I spend more time with it and see newer content on it.  I give it 3 stars currently, but I'm sure I'll bump it up to 4 in time.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV...  Very Happy customer!!
Reviews.Author: Zbowdawg
Reviews.Content: Very good TV, great picture...  not knowing much about TVs, I tried to find one that would work best as a monitor since I watch TV through my PC.  I also have a 50" plasma which has a great picture but plasma runs very hot, so I decided to try LCD.  I had read that they run much cooler than plasma...  true.** Awesome picture size!!  Small bezel so you see picture, not TV.** There is only one button control on the TV itself which seems to cycle through the various commands, so I use the remote for everything.  ...and the remote is pretty easy to master.** Not very heavy but should still use two people to move and set up...  for safety.** When I made my purchase, the description of the base was much smaller than what was received, though due to the size, I am glad the base was larger. Even so, if slightly bumped, it will still wobble.** Remote controls and TV setup is easy to understand navigate.  Most of the presets are perfect and needed no adjustments.** Sound quality is pretty good, plenty of it if you do not have a surround sound system or other receiver system.  I do run sound through a 5.1 receiver and bypass the TV speaker system.** There are no fancy apps or internet, though the Blu Ray player I have has all that, so I was able to save some money purchasing this set which is pretty much basic.** Lastly, I was weary of making such a large purchase on-line, but Amazon takes all the worry out of it...  during the purchase, I was able to select a delivery date and time and when the TV was delivered, the delivery company unpacked it and tested it to make sure it worked before I signed for it...  that was real nice.I would recommend this TV if you want a basic HD TV with a very large, very good HD picture, HD applies to HD signal...  if you don't have HD cable, the picture is very blurry so don't be disappointed if this is your first HD TV...  every HD TV will be blurry if you don't receive an HD signal from your cable provider or OTA (over-the-air, antenna).Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: i did loose in the lcd display lottery
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: First, i bought a $999 Vizio 60-inch lcd and it stopped working after 5 weeks. I thought that maybe i could put some more money and bet on a more known brand so we went for a Samsung.Well let me start with the control: it isn't very comfortable to use. Then , the menu: it looks kind of old, difficult to understand and slow. And you know what? If the display had been good i wouldn't mind about the menu and any other flaw, but sadly it wasn't $1000+Dollars worthy. The display wasn't what i expected: it looked not bright, like filtered. The colors weren't bright, during quick scenes you could see "shadows" when something moved.The final that make me return it its that se started to notice a blue hue on one side of the screen.I wouldn't recommend this product, yes mine could have been a bad lemon, but its a risky bet as well, i expected more from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful LED, I found Plasma TVs better though
Reviews.Author: Inspired Dribble
Reviews.Content: This Samsung UN60EH6000 is a beautiful LED TV.  Nice black non reflective screen reveals some of the highest quality scenes that I have seen with an LED.  Wonderful color and resolution.  If you want a high definition LED and don't need the gimicky 3D or wireless, this TV is one of the best LEDs, at any price.  By the way, it is a back lit LED, which appears more attractive than side lit unless you plan on watching from the side.  (FYI, if you didn't already know, LEDs are LCD TVs with LED back lighting).  HOWEVER, what you may see in the showroom comparing LED TVs to Plasma, may not at all be what you see at home...I had both the Samsung LED mentioned and the Panasonic Plasma in my home at the same time.  I definitely preferred the Samsung LED in the showroom where the bright LED Samsung handled the bright environment better than the Plasma TVs which hadn't been set up right for that environment and appeared dark and dull.  However, when at home away from the bright showroom and with the settings adjusted on both the LED and Plasma TVs, I preferred the Panasonic Plasma TV over the Samsung.I have a base Panasonic model TC-P60U50 60" plasma TV (well reviewed), and in my opinion its picture bested the Samsung LED.  The Panasonic Plasma seemed to have more beautiful rich natural textured skin tones and color balance, superior dark black contrast and backgrounds, and in general appeared warmer and more natural, seemingly less digital although equal in resolution, and just plain provided a more stunning and more comfortable to view picture.  It appears to me that for my preferences, Plasma TVs have an inherent advantage in general over LED TVs.Be aware that the glass screen of the Plasma TVs is highly reflective compared to LEDs.  However, their viewing angle is superior and although they use more electricity, the cost difference is probably less than $15 per year.  As I was able to get a nicely bright picture at 50-60% brightness in the daytime from my plasma at home, it seems visibility for daytime viewing should not be an issue if the Plasma TV settings have been made properly. Heat with modern plasmas is not an issue as the screen of Plasmas is only slightly warm to the touch (no more fans or noticeable heat given off).  They are almost as thin as an LED, and are only a little heavier.  The Panasonic Plasma ST on up series has an anti reflective coating, better daytime viewing, and is a Smart TV and has a close but slightly better picture than the base Panasonic Plasma P60U50 referenced in this review and of course is much more expensive.  .I have heard some rumbling about reliability and speculation from some people that the modern plasma TVs in order to be more competitive, have had some of their internal power generating electronics compromised with cheaper capacitors, resistors, etc, than what was put in earlier plasma TVs.  If you suspect that there is some credibility to that, I think it might be wise to offset the lower price of plasmas over LEDs, by buying the extended insurance or consider buying an led instead.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: G. Greenidge
Reviews.Content: I have bought a number of Samsung flat screen LED HD TV's to use in the office for use during presenations.  I have not been dispointed.  Samsung TV's are easy to set up, simple to use, and have excellent picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60" HDTV
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: TV has a great picture and plenty of adjustments to tweak it to your liking. Amazon Free Shipping and a Square Trade Warranty made it a deal I couldn't pass up. The delivery guys brought it in the house, unboxed it, plugged it in and put the batteries in the remote. They made sure everything was working properly before they left. Other places charge an extra $99.00 for the same delivery that they call White Glove. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Thin blue line after 2 hours of use
Reviews.Author: G. Louis
Reviews.Content: I received my 60" UN60EH6000  today in flawless condition. I waited the 3 hours recommended by the delivery driver so that the unit could warm up to room temperature. After doing so, I hooked it up to my theater system and powered it on. The colors and quality were great. But after 2 hours, a thin, vertical, blue line appeared suddenly on the left side of the screen.I called Samsung, performed the troubleshooting, and was told that the TV would need to be repaired. Unfortunately, the earliest a technician can arrive is 7 days from now. So here I am at the advent of Superbowl weekend, planning on having visitors over to watch the game, and I have a TV with a blue line "enhancing" my picture.Yes, I get it. Defective products "happen." But search the Amazon reviews and you'll see that I'm not the first to have this problem. Search the Internet, and you'll find even more. Sure, my TV will be repaired. But how long until I get this issue again? And when it happens two weeks outside of my warranty, I'm sure Samsung will be more than happy to take care of it for me then too, right?This was my first Samsung TV purchase, and it will probably be my last.

Reviews.Title: The TV stand never worked for us
Reviews.Author: buyer
Reviews.Content: I like the TV quality of the picture, but the TV stand never worked for us.We have tried to contact the seller and exchange that out, but we haven't heard anything. We were not in a residence to mount otherwise that may have been better. We just moved to a home where we can mount, so it will cost me money now to find a mount.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service and amazing picture.
Reviews.Author: BadChinese
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a little over 4 months now.  It is a great looking set as long as you are ok with no audio output and only 2 HDMI inputs.  That was not a deal breaker for me as I have a receiver that handles all of my HDMI switching and audio needs.  (I think TV manufactures assume/want people to have audio setups on bigger TV's because the speakers are always not as powerful as the TV needs)  But I love the picture quality and sharpness of the TV.  The Price I got at Wal-Mart (just under $700) was amazing for what I got.But after 4 months I did develop 3 small lines horizontally thru the set.  I used the online repair request and in less then 1.5 weeks I had a tech at my house replacing the panel.  There was no problem with getting them to come to my house and fix the TV.  I didn't even have to show a receipt!  I had it just incase when the Tech arrived.So for a low buck, big screen TV I think this is the ticket!My advise is to skip the 3d, ultra thin, super wiz bang TV's and get a large nice TV like this for 1/3 the price and you will be happy and you will be able to upgrade to a larger TV sooner!

Reviews.Title: Great sound, miniscule viewing area, no wi fi
Reviews.Author: James R. Broderick "Jim"
Reviews.Content: We bought this 60" Samsung LED tv about 3 weeks ago.  We loved the sound so put up with the fact that we had to keep tilting it to get color in the picture.  I wouldn't even say a quality viewing area is as much as 45 degrees.Last night I decided to register the wi fi and found it had none.  Last straw we brought it back today.We had decided to try another brand because all of our tv's are Vizio's.  There's a good reason for that, other than attractive cost.So we brought home a nice razor led Vizio, also 60" today.  Even our oldest Vizio's perform better than this, with a 176 degree viewing area.We also got $170 back since Vizio wasn't on sale anymore, but we can live with the added $80 to get a good tv.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the price! If you don't want to pay $2,000+
Reviews.Author: Joseph Tong
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this online and it got here quickly.Pro's: Thin, Energy Saver, Picture is decent.Con's: Sound is less than my expectation.The TV was mounted on a wall and tilted.  looks great!

Reviews.Title: Happy with this television.
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Television met all expectations...excellent picture quality. Already had wifi blu ray player, so did not need any smart features.  Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Clark Robbins
Reviews.Content: Expectations were met and this TV is great.  There has been some comments about the Soap Opera Effect, I have seen it some, but not enough to dock points from this being such a great picture.  Being able to play media off of the USB drive is such a big plus.  I've been able to play MKV files and straight AVI.  Couldn't have asked for a better result. Shipping was fast and not a single scratch thanks to CEVA shipping.  I have a high regard for Amazon and the products I get through it.

Reviews.Title: The quality I expected from a Samsung
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Upgraded my 46" LCD Samsung from a few years ago. This is basically the same picture only bigger which is exactly what I was looking for. I don't see how you can get a better picture quality for the price either. Purchased the Sharp 60" LED/LCD that was about $200 cheaper before this one and then ended up returning it a few days later. The picture quality of that doesn't even come close to the Samsung.If you want an LED-LCD TV without any of the extras this is the one I'd suggest. My only concern is 2 HDMI port's, but for the picture quality and price I am willing to just plug/unplug as needed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60-inch TV
Reviews.Author: Jerry Oberhelman
Reviews.Content: The TV was priced to my expectation. It has all the features I need, and the controls are very good.

Reviews.Title: hdmi concern on samsung eh6000
Reviews.Author: sulliva
Reviews.Content: Many people have expressed frustration because the 6000 has only 2 hdmi inputs.  Amazon sells an adapter that adds 3 auto switching hdmi ports for $11.00 http://www.amazon.com/HDMI-3-In-1-Out-Switch-Cable/dp/B0018DQYQ2. This is a simple and clean solution.  So dont pass up a really great tv and a good bargain to boot because of a non-problem.

Reviews.Title: ****WARNING:  DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
Reviews.Author: stephanie linehan
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic tv and a great price. We looked at similar tv's at local retailers but they wouldn't match the price. The picture quality is amazing and very pleased with the audio. We have already recommended this product to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Only two HDMI ports
Reviews.Author: MCoz
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the TV in general, but I am surprised that it has only two HDMI input ports. In this day and age of cable, dvd players, video game consoles, and Roku, two HDMI ports doesn't cut it. It does have a video input and a USB port, but most devices today use HDMI.

Reviews.Title: First Samsung
Reviews.Author: gps
Reviews.Content: Believe this is the first Samsung product I've ever purchased.  Ratings of this specific model were good and a few personal references about Samsung, generally, were good as well.  This tv replaced a 55-in Vizio I'd had about 3 years.  Vizio was very good and this Samsung appears to be very good as well.  Have had it about 3 weeks and it's been flawless.  This 60-in is actually smaller and much lighter than the 55-in Vizio so was easier to handle and wall-mount.  Only very slight dissapointment is that the picture blur or static that can be seen during fast movement/action (ballgames in particular) is still there in this model, like other older models, even though I interpreted some of the spec/promotional material to indicate this model has eliminated or improved it.  Well, it may be improved but it's not entirely gone.  Regardless, very good tv.

Reviews.Title: Needs careful setup
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: ....own a Samsung 52' TV from four years ago (also backlit) and insist on their technology.... this TV challenged me though because it came out of the box with an inferior picture to the distinct, lifelike image of my older model (moved to bedroom, still great!)... spent a LONG time adjusting controls and was about to return it until I finally just started over.... put all the color/picture controls into the center of their range and SLOWLY adjusted each to meet my eye and room light... the backlight I kept high (19) and the contrast (72) and sharpness (86)... bright still at 50, color 46 (both midrange)... I did use the Dynamic setting to get the exceptional clarity Samsung is known for and used whatever advanced settings appealed to my eye... kept white balance controls near the center range (did not really understand how to evaluate these so played it safe, no extremes)....so this needs a lot of attention to finally produce the excellent picture that is possible... very happy now!

Reviews.Title: A good but not excelence one.
Reviews.Author: hung d pham
Reviews.Content: The  time setting is Baaaad !!! It can't be set correctly because the software are wrong. All of my 2 Samsung TVs are that way ! I am in Chicago, but I have to set my TVs in Central mountain time in order to match with TV stations here ! My 46" Toshiba smaller TV (not smart TV) has many good features that this big Samsung TV does not have ! This is just a basic big TV that are over priced ! It's strong point is a good reception/ tunner CKT. It can't be hooked up with my lap top with out spending over $100. for cables and conversion box which quality and reliability are somethings unknown and costly if they are not ! Samsung eleminated the SGA port to save a dollar, but it cost buyer over $100 and a lot of headaches  !  I do not reccommend this TV to anyone who want to use it with their computer at all . LG, Sharp TVs are cheaper and just as good if not better ! Samsung has a bigger name now ?

Reviews.Title: Good picture for the price
Reviews.Author: Charles C. Ng "Chuckie Cheesie"
Reviews.Content: After doing some first hand research (actually looking at different 60" screens), I settled on this Samsung.  The picture quality was good, the motion was crisp, and colors were spot on.  There are screens with slightly better picture quality, but for almost twice the price.  Also the USB can play videos, music, and pictures on the screen, although the tv lacks a DVI or VGA connection, so if you plan on connecting a computer, you will need a HDMI video card or an adapter.P.S. If you order it on Amazon, make sure your profile email and phone number are correct BEFORE you order.  The freight carrier will not deliver unless they can reach you.  I updated my phone number at the end of the order, and Amazon sent my 2 year old number to the carrier instead.  The email the carrier got was also incorrect because their system does not accept "+" characters.  And if they cannot schedule the drop with you in person, they will not deliver regardless what Amazon says.  I called Amazon on the date of delivery, and they told me that the item should be delivered as expected.  I ended up getting it 2 days later.  To Amazon's credit, they made it right by giving me a slight refund.

Reviews.Title: 60inch led samsung tv
Reviews.Author: Unhappy D
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tv.  It has a clear sharp picture and every thing claimed it would do, it does exceptionally well.  My wife and I are very pleased with this Samsung tv.  The people at Amazon were very helpful and delivered as they promised.  Dennis Armand

Reviews.Title: OMG-  What a stunning Picture!
Reviews.Author: Theresa Carroll "Theresa C."
