Reviews.Content: Thsi review is going to be very basic and cut dry.  I bought this TV for my husband for fathers day.  The price point was perfect, and we don't need all the extra crap that they sell you-  I needed a few inputs and an incredible picture-  I got that.  The colors are bright, SHARP, defined and just plain realistic.  Out of the box it was pretty much ready to go.  It was very easy to get this working with my ancient DVD reciever (well the speaker portion)  It does NOT like those yellow red and white componet cables.. so if you use those-  forget it.  You MUST use monster cables or HDMI.  If not your picture will suffer dearly.  I bought a 90 dollar blue ray player-  hooked it up using HDMI.. and bingo-  perfect picture.  If you just want a TV.  This is an amazing one for the price.I researched for a couple weeks and came back to this one 3 times.. Price dropped at a local warehouse store and I couldn't resist,.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this tv.  Save yourself the trouble.  Google "Samsung tv turns on and off by its self" this is what mine started doing after less than 45 days.  I looked at all the reviews before I bought mine and I was a little worried so I bought the extended warranty.  This tv ended up being a POS.

Reviews.Title: Love the TV
Reviews.Author: Caryn K.
Reviews.Content: The TV was great the fight over the delivery agents was not fun it caused a delay in the customer receiving the product. When the TVfinally arrived the driver was so nice but needed help carrying it in...we felt bad! But the TV is fantastic...right price we are very happy.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Maurice Lazarus
Reviews.Content: We already have an LG smart, Phillips & Samsung and this is  the first 60inch.  I just wanted a simple TV with Picture Quality in 60inch and after doing a lot of research and looking at TV displays in the local Stores and reading customer reviews decided on  this particular model. The set up was easy and have now had this for approx. two months and I have no complaints so far. The Sound quality seemed a bit strange initially and I had read some complaints in the reviews about sound, but after some time I guess it seems OK to me. Happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't have asked for a better TV
Reviews.Author: Brandon Burgess
Reviews.Content: Love this TV and the price match assurance saved me $190 after I purchased it.  First time buying a "big ticket" item on Amazon and definately will not be my last as it was a flawless process

Reviews.Title: Aww yea
Reviews.Author: SystemDnB
Reviews.Content: At first I was being all cheap on getting the 60' and bought the Sony Vizo against my better judgement. Big mistake btw that TV sucks!!! Anyways I own a 42 and 46' Samsung they are both awesome too! So just spend the extra couple hundred compared to most other companies and go with Samsung. Best quality there is IMO.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Riley Moore
Reviews.Content: we purchased this on a 2012 black friday deal, the 60" version.no complaints great TV for the money we paid

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: Sumedh Sakdeo
Reviews.Content: have been using this tv from last two months and quality is awesome.speaker could have been better however, i have external audio systems so does not matter to me.

Reviews.Title: Time Will Tell
Reviews.Author: J. Larimer "Resoguy"
Reviews.Content: My initial reaction to this TV is that it is great and I'm glad I purchased it. You have to understand that this is my first flat screen TV and it is replacing a 25" Zenith that is 20 years old and still works fine. I am not a gamer and primarily watch TV and or discs. I also purchased a blueray player to appreciate the effect of HD on this TV but otherwise, only watch stations that come in via my antenna. I haven't had cable service for about 10 years now. That being said, the TV seems great to me. Glad I got the 60" and nothing smaller. I'm good with the limited inputs since I don't need them. The most noticable downside at this point is the audio. I can see why it would be worthwhile to purchase a surround sound audio system to enhance the sound from the TV...it is not exceptional. The true test will be if the newer TV holds up as long as the one being replaced. If it does, I may upgrade this review to 5-star!

Reviews.Title: Help- Soap Opera Effect on Movies
Reviews.Author: teegeepen
Reviews.Content: love the tv..sharp picture, great for sports ..but any advice on getting rid of the "soap opera" effect...would like to watch movies in HD, the way they were intended..

Reviews.Title: Best way to buy a TV
Reviews.Author: S. Herzfeld "Avid Reader"
Reviews.Content: After researching the TV on line and through Amazon reviews and going and looking at it in the store, we purchased this 60" TV from Amazon.  It was delivered 2 days later with white glove service.  Great customer service with the white glove service and the TV is perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: Las Vegas Vern
Reviews.Content: I have purchased quite a few TVs in my life, but this one is the best I've ever purchased.  There was a little mix up in the delivery times, but I would make the same purchase a 2nd time with no problem.

Reviews.Title: great product for $$ we paid!
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: It's a great TV. We've only had it for a few weeks, but the quality is great. Amazon delivered and set it up for us which is a pleasant surprise. We've had several Samsung TV's now, and they do not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: picture is not as good as Panasonic or sony
Reviews.Author: zach bostock
Reviews.Content: The soap opera picture had to be cleaned up and that causes picture to not be as clean.  buy something different

Reviews.Title: NO AUDIO OUTPUTS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Wynn
Reviews.Content: This means that you will not be able to hook up a sound system to the TV for everything to play through it. You will have to hook up your sound system to your game console then switch it to your cable box and then to your DVD player..... All because it won't hook directly to the TV, you must connect it to the actual device which is a real pain in the arse because then I have to switch it to each component in use or pay more money for some type of hub. I just think its incredible that an HDTV doesn't come with an audio output.SAMSUNG you really dropped the ball on this one....

Reviews.Title: bad display on first use, and a broken remote as well
Reviews.Author: B. Humphrey
Reviews.Content: Just mounted the TV on the wall, plugged it in, and the first clue should have been the remote was bad... but I press on and find the power button/mini joystick controller and fire up the TV.  Right away there was a noticeable dark/off color area.  I call up Samsung and the lady was nice enough, got the order in for the repair and gave the info on who will be contacting me. She then proceeds to enter the issue for the remote and she puts me on hold, then comes back and notes that their system can only take one issue a day so that I will have to call back tomorrow to complete the request to get the remote replaced.I think it just may have to go back and buy something else.Brett

Reviews.Title: Everything expected
Reviews.Author: texasfire
Reviews.Content: Product just as pictured and described on website.  Feel like I'm in a ful blown theater.  Blue Ray is mind blowing

Reviews.Title: Defective..., I hope. Not HD, more like SD! What a dissappointment.
Reviews.Author: My Life is Just One Drama After Another
Reviews.Content: I was so dissappointed when choosing a brand new HD TV. We had an older model Mitsubishi that failed after several years of high usage. But the HD was the best I'd ever seen and figured all HD TV's were the same. Wow, so not so! This Samsung was given high praise by most people but maybe they didn't have a Mitsubishi to compare to. I truly hope this was defective or Samsung has more problems. Plus is was so bright..., yes, I corrected it as best I could. I adjusted the contrast all the way to 100% and could still not see facial clarity. Not to mention how bright everything was. Faces looked like SD..., all smooth.We decided not to try another Samsung and are waiting for our Sharp HD TV to arrive. Too bad Mitsibushi only makes really BIG SCREEN TV's nowadays. They truly are the best.

Reviews.Title: Trouble
Reviews.Author: Alexszly
Reviews.Content: The first shippment was damaged, the second replacement unit was defective, finally the third unit arrived, which to this point is still working.,

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: Danny Wonch
Reviews.Content: i bought 2 60 inch Samsungs and they work great i use them in the confronce rooms as monitors sweet

Reviews.Title: TV is broken on arrival
Reviews.Author: NotSoHappyCamper
Reviews.Content: Screen is severely damaged along edges. Cable input doesn't work. Base doesn't attach securely and the TV shakes a bit on it. Overall, the quality of the TV seems cheap and easily damaged.

Reviews.Title: are you for real???
Reviews.Author: couch potato
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying the picture quality is fantastic.  Looks sleek and is a qualitative made product.  However.......I had read many reviews on this tv before purchasing it and was well aware that it had only two hdmi inputs which for the price I decided that I could live with but.......what i was not aware of was that it has no audio outputs!  WTF!!!  I have $1000 dollars worth of audio equipment and no way of hooking it up!  I only have analog cable at the moment so there are no outputs to hook my receiver to.  They had the tv mounted in the store so that i could not see the back of it and just figured for that kind of money it would at least have the same number of hookups as the $80 tv I have in the kids room.  I figured wrong.  Whoever engineered a tv with no outputs should go in his garage start his car with the door closed and take that long nap!  Anyone thinking of buying this tv should be prepared for a night of disappointment instead of a night of happiness as you had just gotten what you thought was an awesome tv.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality and service
Reviews.Author: Grady Parker
Reviews.Content: I have  a 67" Samsung DLP TV that cost $2500 from Costco.  After warranty expired ( a very short 1 year) the TV developed white spots due to the failure of the DLP chip.  Despite an overwhelming number of customers with the same problem Samsung refuses to address the problem even though they did a secret recall on the 61" version of this TV.  Do an internet search on white dot problem.

Reviews.Title: Product Failed
Reviews.Author: SD
Reviews.Content: Bought the 60 in TV in August 2012. Died Jan 2013. Has a dark blue screen with nothing on it.  Samsung will not send somebody to service it till I give them the Serial #.  The Serial # is on the back of the TV mounted on the fireplace.  I paid $150 to have it mounted - needs two people.  Now I have to pay someone to take the TV down - give them the serial number - and if it is fixed or replaced pay another $150 to have it mounted again. Will cost me an additional $300.  Aaargh!So its like if your car is under warranty and dies and the dealership will not pay for the wrecker to bring the car to the dealership to get it repaired. Way to go SAMSUNG!

Reviews.Title: Motion Handling = Truly terrible
Reviews.Author: X
Reviews.Content: The 60 inch version of this TV is terrible.  It cannot handle motion on Mad Men, much less any sporting event.  And yes, I am tech savvy.  And yes, I tried every combination of settings possible.  It's just really, really bad.  Amazon is picking it up next week and leaving the Panasonic TC-P60ST50 in its place.  We'll see.

Reviews.Title: So much for the feedback on this forum. I am thoroughly disappointed with this TV and wish I could return it.
Reviews.Author: Christian Wagner
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV new last week... I read all of the reviews on Amazon and beyond and thought it was a good deal. I also bought a "matching" Samsung HT-E5500W Home Theater. Both brand new items... Well guess what? The systems don't sync up together. My 2008 Sony LCD TV and Home Theater sync up. Guess what the Samsung rep says? You bought the basic model. Now after several hours of trying to get the system's remotes to work together.... where I can control the volume of the Home Theater with the television remote, I can't! What a joke. I hope Amazon will let me return it. I would prefer to pay extra to get a system that works together! This is a base model. Look at other sites it will tell you that this is a thick LED TV!

ProductInfo.Features:
Full HD 1080p
Clear Motion Rate 240
Connect Share Movie
Wide Color Enhancer Plus
TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1-Inch x 33.8-Inch x 13-Inch, TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 54.1-Inch x 31.8-Inch x 3.7-Inch
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN60EH6000 60-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV (Black) (2012 Model)
